thread.title: Dating App Tinder Introduces The 'Super Like'
thread.title_full: Dating App Tinder Introduces The 'Super Like'

author: news.sky
title: Dating App Tinder Introduces The 'Super Like'
text:
When it comes to the world of online dating, it's usually wise to follow the words of Del Boy and "play it nice and cool". But if you're bowled over by someone's photographs and witty profile and simply must connect with them, the world's most popular dating app now lets you show just how keen you are.
Smartphone app Tinder - which matches people who swipe right on each other's profiles - has rolled out the "Super Like".
Once a day, you can swipe up on a potential matches profile - showing a heightened level of interest.
Tinder's video shows a superhero 'rescuing' a woman from unwanted suitors
When swiping through potential Tinder matches, users will be able to see whether another user has Super Liked them thanks to a blue footer appearing on their profile.
The new feature was announced in a movie trailer-style video, which shows a woman being harassed by potential matches she doesn't like.
Then she is rescued by a superhero, and presented with a suitor who has Super Liked her.
Tinder chief executive Sean Rad said: "A 'like' or 'swipe right' has long served as an anonymous way to express interest in someone, similar to a glance across the room.
"Because they're so limited in number, a Super Like, or a 'swipe up', sends a more powerful signal, conveying an especially high level of interest.
"People like to know that someone finds them special, and we think this will lead to even better matches."
